p: Escherichia coli was the predominant pathogen (43%), followed by Staphylococcus pseudintermedius (8%), Staphylococcus aureus (8%), Streptococcus faecalis (7%), Klebsiella pneumoniae (6%), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (5%) and other 13 species. A predominance of single isolates (89.4%) compared to polymicrobial infections (10.6%) was observed.
